titleStmt.title: SII 14.141: original edition by A. S. Ramanatha Ayyar
No. 141. (A.R. No. 115 of 1905.) TIRUVĀLĪŚVARAM, AMBASAMUDRAM TALUK, TIRUNELVELI DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE VĀLĪŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: The record dated in the 11th year of Jaṭāvarman Sundara-Chōḷapāṇḍya registers a gift of cows by the mahāsabhā of Rājarāja-chaturvēdimaṅgalam for burning a lamp in the temple of god Tiruvālīśvaramuḍaiyār. Several other similar endowments are also recorded in continuation of this gift.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . koccaṭaiyapaṉmarāyiṉa śrīcuntaracoḻapāṇṭiyatevarkku yāṇṭu 11Āvatu rāja
rājap pāṇṭiñāṭṭu muṭikoṇṭacoḻavaḷanāṭṭu muḷḷiñāṭṭu brahmateyam śrīrājarājaccatup peti
maṅkalattut tiruvāliccaramuṭaiyārkku muṉ mahāsabhaiyār vaicca tirununtāviḷakku Oṉṟu
Iṭaiyaṉ kāricentaṉ(ṉa) vacam kuṭutta cāvāmuvāppacu 2 10 5 Irupattañcāl Aṭṭa kaṭava
ney Uḻakku Inney Uḻakkum maṭṭuvatāka koṇṭa
Ik koyil tevarkku muṉ mel piṭākai merur Irukkum veḷḷāḷaṉ ce
vaṉ brahmakuṭṭaṉ vaicca tirunontāviḷakku Oṉṟu Iṭaiyaṉ Añci kāricaṇaṉ Aṭṭa
kaṭava ney Uḻakkiṉukku koṇṭa Erumai 3 10 5 Ivaṉukku puṇai taṉiyāṉ ṭṭāṇai
y Ikkoyil tevarkkum yivvūrirukkum yiṭaiyaṉ kākuttaṉ karumāṇikka
viḷakku Arai viḷakkiṉukku Erikka koṇṭa caravā muvā perāṭu 2 10 5 Appi cūṟṟikku puṇai Oḷi In continuation of the above is the following portion belonging to a different record:— 1 kaḷakkuṭi••••śrī rājarājaccarupetimaṅkalattu mahāsabhaiyom Olai . nam karaṇattār kaḷum nam piṭā- 2 kai[y] uḻavukuṭikaḷum kaṇṭu namakku tiruvāliccara muṭaiyār tirunantavāṉam irājendracoḻaṉ 3 ceykiṉṟār uḻuta nilam iṟaiy koḷḷātoḻivārākavum ivaṉaiyum ivaṉ makan pattaiyu- 4 ••••••• paṇikkap paṇiccuk karai yiṭṭuk karai ponta ceri 3 ceri cāntūr aṉantapura••• This record is incomplete and is much damaṅed.
Digital edition of SII 14.141 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
